alert.note: Alert for Marin (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 1:01PM PST until March 10 at 5:45PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .River and creek levels will remain elevated this afternoon. Flooding will continue for the Willow Brook, the Laguna de Santa Rosa, Mark West Creek, and Colgan Creek. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Marin and Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 700 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1259 PM PST, Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. This includes the Willow Brook, the Laguna de Santa Rosa, Mark West Creek, and Colgan Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Petaluma, Novato, Rohnert Park, Sebastopol, Cotati, South Santa Rosa Cdp, Roseland, Black Point-Green Point, Forestville, Glen Ellen, Temelec and South Santa Rosa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away.
